multi_loss_mask.Description: Set this to false only if all animals are labeled in every labeled frame.

multi_crop_ims.Description: Set this to false to force training on the entire image/frame.

multi_crop_im_sz.Description: If images are cropped for training, then this is the size for cropping. This is auto computed. This is the size of the smallest square that covers the largest cluster of labeled animals that have overlapping masks.

multi_match_dist.Description: The distance between two poses is compared to the bounding box sizes of the poses. If the average distance between the landmarks is smaller than this fraction (in percentage) of bounding box edge size, then merge the two predictions. Mainly for MA-Grone.

MinAspectRatio.Description: Minimum aspect ratio for bounding boxes.

save_step.Description: How often (number of iterations of gradient descent) to save intermediate trackers during training.

display_step.Description: How often (number of iterations of gradient descient) to compute the training error.

maxckpt.Description: Number of intermediate trackers during training to keep at once.

ImageProcessing.Description: Parameters related to initial processing of the input video data before any learning happens.

scale.Description: Downsample images in width and height by this factor. This will decrease the amount of memory needed on the GPU.

adjustContrast.Description: Normalize image contrast using contrast limited adaptive histogram equalization (CLAHE).

clahe_grid_size.Description: CLAHE normalizes contrast in local neighborhoods -- squares with this side length, in pixels.

normalize.Description: Normalize images by subtracting the average pixel intensity in the image.

flipud.Description: Whether to flip images upside down.

imax.Description: Maximum pixel value in the video.

GradientDescent.Description: Parameters related to gradient-descent-based optimization of the tracker.

dl_steps.Description: Number of iterations of gradient descent to train the tracker for. Longer training generally works better, but takes longer.

batch_size.Description: Number of training examples used in each iteration of gradient descent. Too large of values may cause the GPU to run out of memory. Too small of values may make training slower and result in poor optimization. When changed to 8/x, it is suggested to increase the number of training iterations by x for better performance. Does not apply to DeepLabCut where batch size is always 1.

learning_rate_multiplier.Description: Learning rate multplier for networks other than deeplabcut. If the multiplier is m, and base learning rate is 0.0001 then then learning rate used will be 0.0001*m. Does not apply to LEAP and DeepLabCut.

lr_drop_step.Description: At the end of training, the fraction of training steps to train at lower learning rate.

cos_steps.Description: OBSOLETE Number of times to restart training

decay_steps.Description: OBSOLETE The learning rate is decayed by gamma (below) after this many iterations of training. Does not apply to LEAP and DeepLabCut.

gamma.Description: OBSOLETE Amount to decay the learning rate by after the number of decay iterations above. Does not apply to LEAP and DeepLabCut.

num_test.Description: Number of training examples to use to compute the training error.

normalize_loss_batch.Description: Normalize the loss by the batch size. Not normalizing is better

DataAugmentation.Description: To learn invariances to certain kinds of perturbations, training data can be augmented by randomly perturbing each image during training.

rrange.Description: Augment by rotating training images and labels by a random angle less than this number of degrees in either direction.

trange.Description: Augment by translating training images and labels by a random amounts in both x- and y- directions less than this number of pixels.

scale_factor_range.Description: Augment by adjusting image scale by a random factor between (1/this number) to (this number). 1 indicates no scale adjustment, 2 indicates scaling by a factor between 1/2 to 2

crange.Description: Augment by adjusting image contrast by a random amount less than this number. 0 indicates no contrast adjustment, 1 indicates maximum contrast adjustment

brange.Description: Augment by adjusting image brightness by a random amount less than this number. 0 indicates no brightness adjustment, 1 indicates maximum brightness adjustment.

horz_flip.Description: Augment by flipping the training image and labels horizontally (left to right). Set pairs of corresponding landmarks by selecting "Select landmark flip pairings" from the Track menu.

vert_flip.Description: Augment by flipping the training image ang labels vertically (bottom to top). Set pairs of corresponding landmarks by selecting "Select landmark flip pairings" from the Track menu.

check_bounds_distort.Description: Check that landmarks remain within the image during augmentation.

LossFunction.Description: Parameters related to the deep-learning error criterion minimized.

label_blur_rad.Description: Standard deviation, in pixels, of the landmark location. In the label heatmap used for training, a Gaussian with this std-dev is placed at each landmark location. Only applicable to heatmap based methods. Not applicable to DeepLabCut and LEAP.

TargetCrop.Description: APT crops out regions centered around each detected animal and runs part-tracking on these image crops. These parameters describe how image patches around individual animals are cropped out.

ManualRadius.Description: Radius (in pixels) of the square cropped around each target.

AlignUsingTrxTheta.Description: If true, align cropped images using head-tail orientation or using trx.theta if the project uses trx files.
AlignUsingTrxTheta.DispName: Align using head-tail or using trajectory theta

PadBkgd.Description: If the cropped regions need to be padded, this value indicates the image intensity to pad with.

multi_scale_by_bbox.Description: For pose estimation (stage 2), crop the image around animal based on their detected size and scale the cropped image to a common size before estimating the pose. Useful if the visual scale of the animals varies a lot. Unselect if the apparent scale of all the animals does not change. In this case, all detected animals are cropped uniformly.
multi_scale_by_bbox.DispName: Use animal's size to determine the cropping size

LossMask.Description: Parameters for masking loss to handle unlabeled targets

PadFactor.Description: Dimensionless factor controlling width of padding around target. A value of 1 indicates a tight fit around the landmark convex hull.

PadFloor.Description: Minimum width of padding around target, in pixels.

AlignHeadTail.Description: If true, align masks to animal using head/tail landmarks
AlignHeadTail.DispName: Align mask using head/tail landmark specifications

min_n_animals.Description: APT will detect at least this many animals in each frame.

max_n_animals.Description: APT will detect at most this many animals in each frame.

TrackletStitch.Description: Parameters for stitching tracked targets into tracklets

link_stage.Description: Whether to stitch detections into tracklets at the first (detection) stage, or the second (pose-tracking) stage.

link_id.Description: Whether to stitch detections using identity tracking.

link_maxcost_heuristic.Description: Method to compute the cutoff for linking. Secondorder sets the cutoff where sorted match distances sharply increases. Prctile computes the cutoff as a percentile of matched distances

link_maxcost_mult.Description: This determines how aggresively tracklets are linked. Value of 1 will not link frames that have unusual large movements. For value less than 1 tracking will break even for usual large movements. Values greater than 1 (3-4) will link detections across large jumps.

link_maxcost_prctile.Description: When using prctile (percentile) method to compute the cutoff, the percentile to use to compute the cutoff.

link_maxframes_delete.Description: Delete trajectories of length shorter than this.

link_maxframes_missed.Description: Maximum gap length in trajectory across which to link trajectory.

link_strict_match_thres.Description: Match a prediction only if the distance to closest match is smaller than the distance to the next closest match by this factor.

link_id_training_iters.Description: Number of steps to training the identity tracker for.

link_id_tracklet_samples.Description: Number of examples to sample from a tracklet when assigning identity.

link_id_rescale.Description: Amount to downsample the cropped animal images for identity tracking.

link_id_batch_size.Description: Batch size to use for training identity network.

link_id_mining_steps.Description: Number of times to do hard triplet mining during identity tracking.

link_id_cropsz.Description: Crop size to use ID linking. If less than 0, the automatically computed crop size is used
link_id_cropsz.DispName: Crop size to use for ID Linking

link_id_motion_link.Description: Crop size to use ID linking. If less than 0, the automatically computed crop size is used
link_id_motion_link.DispName: Use motion linking before grouping by identity
